title: Documents Allege That Israel’s Spy Agency Encouraged Anti-Government Protests
description: Israeli officials said there was no evidence to support the unsourced claims contained in a leaked Pentagon report.

title: Leaked Document Shows the Dire Nature of Battle for Bakhmut
description: An assessment that appears in a new batch of leaked classified documents appears to show that Ukraine was close to losing a key battle of the war in February.

title: What Leaked Pentagon Documents Show About Wagner’s Influence
description: The Russian mercenary group has extended its network for acquiring weapons — a sign of its reach, but also a possible indication that sanctions are forcing it to branch out from its Russian backers.

title: Overlooked No More: Alice Ball, Chemist Who Created a Treatment for Leprosy
description: After she died — and just a year after her discovery — another scientist took credit for her work. It would be more than half a century until her story resurfaced.

title: Rockets From Lebanon Point to Growing Hamas Cooperation With Hezbollah
description: Israel accused Hamas, a Palestinian militia, of firing rockets into Israel from Lebanon, underscoring its deepening ties with Hezbollah, the dominant Lebanese militia.

title: Leaked Documents Russia’s Military Struggles and Depth of U.S. Spy Efforts
description: The information, exposed on social media sites, also shows that U.S. intelligence services are eavesdropping on important allies.

title: The Russians Took Their Children. These Mothers Went and Got Them Back.
description: Making a nerve-wracking 3,000-mile journey from Ukraine, into Russia-occupied territory, and back again, a group of mothers managed to recover their children from the custody of the Russian authorities.

title: E.P.A. Is Said to Propose Rules Meant to Drive Up Electric Car Sales Tenfold
description: In what would be the nation’s most ambitious climate regulation, the proposal is designed to ensure that electric cars make up the majority of new U.S. auto sales by 2032.

title: Benjamin B. Ferencz, Last Surviving Nuremberg Prosecutor, Dies at 103
description: In addition to convicting prominent Nazi war criminals, he crusaded for an international criminal court and for laws to end wars of aggression.

title: French Visit Undercuts U.S. Efforts to Control China
description: Allies don’t always see things the same way, as Emmanuel Macron’s cozy visit to Xi Jinping made abundantly clear.

title: China Rejects W.H.O. Accusations of Hiding Wuhan Covid Data
description: The rebukes came after overseas researchers discovered sequences that had not been previously shared.

title: A Swedish Warship Sank in 1628. It Is Still Yielding Secrets.
description: Researchers are learning more about those who died after the Vasa sank, including a woman known as “G,” who was long believed by scientists to be a man.

title: New Season, New Music
description: Looking for new music recommendations? Introducing an antidote to the algorithm.

title: Meet Jeremy Hansen, the First Canadian Headed to the Moon
description: Jeremy Hansen, 47, will be one of four astronauts on NASA’s Artemis II moon mission and the first from Canada to venture into deep space.

title: Ukraine Says Russia Is Preparing to Evacuate Civilians From Occupied Areas of South
description: Ukraine is widely expected to launch a counteroffensive in the coming weeks to recapture territory from Russian forces. Military analysts have speculated that it could focus on the south of the country.

title: The Russians Took Their Children. These Mothers Went and Got Them Back.
description: Making a nerve-wracking 3,000-mile journey from Ukraine, into Russia-occupied territory, and back again, a group of mothers managed to recover their children from the custody of the Russian authorities.

title: In a Deadly Mountain Pass, a Tiny Hotel Is a Lifeline
description: Traversing the Sabzak Pass in Afghanistan is treacherous. But for travelers in distress, one innkeeper, who personifies Afghan generosity, is there to help — with a cup of tea, a meal or car repair.

title: Why Pope Francis Is the Star of AI-Generated Photos
description: Francis has become a recurring favorite to show in incongruous situations, such as riding a motorcycle and attending Burning Man, in A.I.-generated images.

title: Marvel Superhero and Indigenous Actress Holds Fast to Maya Roots
description: After filming her part in “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” María Mercedes Coroy returned to her “normal” life of farming and trading in a Guatemalan town at the base of a volcano.

title: China to Do Military Drills Around Taiwan
description: Taiwan’s president visited the United States this week and met with the House speaker, angering Beijing, which had threatened consequences.
